episodeTitle: A Surprising Outcome! White Chase vs. Vergo!
episodeTitleJapanese: 衝撃の決着！白猟（スモーカー）VSヴェルゴ！
episodeTitleRomanized: Shōgeki no Ketchaku! Sumōkā tai Verugo!
description: Luffy continues his battle against Caesar Clown, while Smoker faces off against Vergo in a brutal confrontation. Despite being severely beaten, Smoker manages to retrieve Law's heart and return it to him. With his heart restored, Law unleashes his true power, cutting through Vergo's full-body Haki, the SAD production chamber, and part of Punk Hazard island itself, declaring the arrival of a new era led by the Eleven Supernovas.

events.title: Caesar Warns Luffy About Doflamingo
events.description: Caesar Clown attempts to warn Luffy about the danger of underestimating Donquixote Doflamingo and advises him to apologize for his actions. However, Luffy ignores the warnings and continues to attack Caesar.
events.significance: Sets up the future conflict with Doflamingo while showing Luffy's determination to protect the children regardless of the consequences.

quotes.text: You don't understand who you're dealing with! Joker is not someone you can mess with!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar's warning to Luffy about Doflamingo's power

events.title: Caesar Uses Gastille
events.description: Caesar Clown unleashes his Gastille technique, shooting a beam of lit gas from his mouth that can reach temperatures hot enough to melt steel. Luffy dodges the attack and continues his assault.
events.significance: Demonstrates Caesar's offensive capabilities with his Gas-Gas Fruit powers, though ultimately ineffective against Luffy's speed.

events.title: Vergo Brutally Defeats Smoker
events.description: Vergo overwhelms Smoker with his superior Haki, severely beating him and breaking his Haki-imbued Nanashaku Jitte with his Oni Take technique. Despite the brutal defeat, Smoker refuses to give up.
events.significance: Establishes Vergo as an incredibly powerful Haki user and shows Smoker's determination despite being outmatched. This defeat is crucial for setting up Law's comeback.

events.title: Vergo's Oni Take Breaks Smoker's Jitte
events.description: Vergo demonstrates his signature Oni Take (Demon Bamboo) technique, imbuing his bamboo stick with powerful Armament Haki and striking down to break Smoker's Nanashaku Jitte in half, creating a shockwave that dents several layers of steel.
events.significance: First display of Vergo's signature technique and establishes his mastery of Armament Haki. The destruction of Smoker's weapon symbolizes the power gap between them.

events.title: Smoker Retrieves Law's Heart
events.description: Despite being severely beaten by Vergo, Smoker uses his Logia abilities to create a smokescreen and retrieve Law's heart from Vergo. He remembers Tashigi's words about doing whatever it takes to save their men and makes the difficult decision to help a pirate.
events.significance: A pivotal moment showing Smoker's true character and sense of justice. He gambles on Law's word and helps a pirate, setting up Law's victory. This represents Smoker's growth beyond rigid Marine justice.

quotes.text: Finish it quick. It shames me to be indebted to a pirate.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: Smoker's words to Law after returning his heart, barely conscious

events.title: Law Regains His Heart
events.description: Trafalgar Law receives his heart back from Smoker, immediately restoring his strength and combat abilities. With his heart returned, Law can now fight at full power against Vergo.
events.significance: The turning point of the battle. Law's heart being returned allows him to demonstrate his true strength and fulfill his plan to destroy the SAD production.

events.title: Law's Declaration of the New Era
events.description: Law declares to Doflamingo that the two years since the War of the Best have been a time of preparation, and that the Eleven Supernovas will now lead a new era. He proclaims that he has 'broken the gear' of the old system.
events.significance: A major thematic statement establishing the Worst Generation's role in reshaping the world. Law positions himself and the other Supernovas as the new driving force in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: It's been two years since the War of the Best. Did anyone actually accomplish anything? All you did was stay calm. All Whitebeard did was end the era. The Marines rounded up new forces. The Big Names didn't take any action. It was just like everyone was prepping for something. You always told me that the new era of the daring ones is coming along with an unstoppable swell... Well, I broke the gear.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's declaration to Doflamingo about the Eleven Supernovas and the new era

events.title: Vergo Activates Full-Body Armament Haki
events.description: Vergo demonstrates his incredible Haki mastery by coating his entire body in jet-black Armament Haki, shocking even the injured Smoker. This full-body Haki represents one of the highest levels of Haki control shown up to this point in the series.
events.significance: Establishes Vergo as one of the strongest Haki users in the series at this point. The full-body Haki technique showcases the advanced applications of Busoshoku Haki.

events.title: Law Defeats Vergo and Destroys the SAD Chamber
events.description: In a stunning display of power, Law uses his Room ability to cut through Vergo's full-body Haki, bisecting him along with his bamboo stick. The same slash cuts through the entire SAD production chamber and splits part of Punk Hazard island itself.
events.significance: One of the most impressive feats in the series up to this point, demonstrating that Law's Haki and Devil Fruit mastery surpasses even Vergo's advanced techniques. This destroys Doflamingo's SAD production, disrupting his SMILE business with Kaido.

events.title: Vergo's Body Split in Half
events.description: Vergo's body slides apart in two pieces following Law's devastating attack, with his bisected form displayed on a guardrail in front of the destroyed SAD production machines. Despite his defeat, Vergo remains conscious.
events.significance: The visual conclusion of Vergo's defeat and the destruction of the SAD chamber. This moment symbolizes the end of Doflamingo's manufacturing operation on Punk Hazard.

quotes.text: You don't understand who you're dealing with! Joker is not someone you can mess with!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown

quotes.text: Finish it quick. It shames me to be indebted to a pirate.
quotes.speaker: Smoker
quotes.context: To Law after returning his heart

quotes.text: It's been two years since the War of the Best. Did anyone actually accomplish anything? All you did was stay calm. All Whitebeard did was end the era. The Marines rounded up new forces. The Big Names didn't take any action. It was just like everyone was prepping for something. You always told me that the new era of the daring ones is coming along with an unstoppable swell... Well, I broke the gear.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Declaration to Doflamingo about the new era of the Eleven Supernovas

themes.description: Law's declaration about the Eleven Supernovas leading a new era represents the passing of the torch from the old generation to the new. This theme of generational change has been building since the War of the Best.
themes.symbolism: Law 'breaking the gear' symbolizes disrupting the status quo and forcing change in the established world order.

themes.description: Smoker's decision to help Law, a pirate, demonstrates that true justice sometimes requires working outside the rigid structure of rules. It shows Smoker's growth as a character who prioritizes doing what's right over following orders.
themes.symbolism: Smoker giving Law his heart back symbolizes trust and the blurring of lines between 'good' Marines and 'bad' pirates.

themes.description: The episode showcases how the Supernovas have grown in power over the two-year timeskip. Law's ability to cut through Vergo's advanced Haki demonstrates the new generation surpassing expectations.
themes.symbolism: Law cutting through Vergo and the island represents literally breaking through the old barriers and limitations.

characterSpotlights.role: Central protagonist in his battle against Vergo
characterSpotlights.development: Law demonstrates his incredible growth in power and strategic thinking. His declaration about the new era establishes him as a major player in the world's future.
keyActions: Receives his heart back from Smoker
Declares the arrival of the new era to Doflamingo
Destroys the SAD production chamber and splits Punk Hazard
quotes: It's been two years since the War of the Best... Well, I broke the gear.

characterSpotlights.role: Sacrificial hero who enables Law's victory
characterSpotlights.development: Smoker shows tremendous character growth by choosing to help a pirate for the greater good, despite his pride and injuries. This represents his evolution beyond rigid Marine justice.
keyActions: Creates a smokescreen to retrieve Law's heart
Returns Law's heart, helping a pirate
Acknowledges his debt to a pirate
quotes: Finish it quick. It shames me to be indebted to a pirate.

characterSpotlights.role: Primary antagonist who is ultimately defeated
characterSpotlights.development: Vergo is revealed to be an incredibly powerful Haki master with full-body Armament Haki. However, his defeat shows that the new generation has surpassed even such advanced techniques.
keyActions: Uses Oni Take to break Smoker's jitte

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended Smoker's fight with Vergo with additional combat sequences and exchanges not present in the manga.
The anime added scenes of Chopper treating Mocha and explaining the sedative effects on the children, which were not shown in the manga at this point.

trivia.fact: This episode primarily adapts Chapter 690 of the manga titled 'S.A.D.'
Vergo's full-body Armament Haki is one of the first and most impressive displays of advanced Haki mastery in the series, showcasing a technique that few characters have demonstrated.
Law's feat of cutting through Vergo and splitting Punk Hazard island is referenced as one of the most impressive displays of the Ope Ope no Mi's power in the entire series.
This episode had a TV rating of 8.2%, ranking 4th in its time slot when it aired in Japan.
The opening song 'Hands Up!' was unavailable in the FUNimation simulcast due to copyright issues with the music label, though rights were eventually obtained for the English dub release.
